item.title: Visualization of categorical data in dental research
item.author: sergio.uribe@gmail.com (Sergio Uribe)
item.description: Categorical data is often found in dental research reports. From the clinical perspective, itâ€™s easier to deal and understand since many clinical decisions are categorical: does this surface has caries? have this patient active caries? should I give a treatment? Usually, this data are presented in tables, but there are some visualizations helpful to discover some associations. For example, a survey research investigate the perception of children and their mothers as regards orthodontic treatment need and satisfaction with dental aesthetics (De Souza et al.
